body:
This PR attempts to fix two issues

#29217
#29220

Firstly,
- Both `sendrawtransaction` and `testmempoolaccept` have the optional parameter `maxfeerate`. 
When passed, this parameter ensures that any transactions with a fee rate higher than the specified `maxfeerate` value are rejected.

- `maxburnamount` is also an optional parameter for `sendrawtransaction`. When passed, it rejects transactions with unspendable outputs (e.g., 'datacarrier' outputs using the OP_RETURN opcode) greater than the specified value.

- The newly introduced RPC, `submitpackage`, will also incorporate these sanity checks and support the same optional parameters of `maxfeerate` and `maxburnamount` as a sanity check.

- This PR introduces two new startup config options: 
`maxfeerate` and `maxburnamount`.

- This eliminates the need to pass them explicitly in every RPC call. 

- Instead, `maxfeerate` and `maxburnamount` values passed in a startup will be used by `sendrawtransaction` RPC and friends.

Secondly 
- In some instances within the wallet, as indicated in #29220, where 	`maxtxfee` serves as a quantifier for the maximum fee rate of a transaction. This PR fixes the issue by using the new value passed in the `maxfeerate` startup option as a quantifier instead of maxtxfee.

- However, this adds the default behaviour of `maxfeerate` to the wallet, meaning if users specify a 0 for `maxfeerate`, the wallet will accept transactions with any fee rate.

This approach maintains distinct role for `maxfeerate` as a wallet and mempool acceptance/relay sanity check instead of creating another option for the wallet.
title: RPC: Wallet:  Add `maxfeerate` and `maxburnamount` startup option
